name: places/ChIJOXk3xzhZwokR2Q4HGxsGqug
formattedAddress: 45 Rockefeller Plaza, New York, NY 10111, USA
adrFormatAddress: 45 Rockefeller Plaza, New York, NY 10111, USA

originalText.text:
I was recently booked by Characters for Hire for 2 days of work as a MASCOT for an Exhibitor at a Convention in Orlando.
The Exhibitor provided the Costume. I was hired to show up on time, report to my contact, behave as a professional & follow the VERY strict rules of CFH (imperative for mascots interacting with the public!).
CFP hires actors & performers as independent contractors, therefore a W-9 was included in my 12 page e-sign package.
The specifics of the booking; call time, location, on site contact, etc. were included along with the aforementioned rules, guidelines and expectations.
My exhibitor contact (& her entire team) where awesome, the handler CFH hired was a godsend, the BONUS was finding out my character was a very beloved one that visitors looked forward to posing & interacting with year after year.
As an actor, I enjoyed putting my nonverbal improv skills to work as I interacted, posed & danced around.
I have a lot of experience with events, conventions, etc & our only “glitch” was on the 2nd day with (what I felt was) an overzealous show manager stopping us to say my handler could no longer escort me thru the show floor to the bathroom for my BRIEF costume & potty breaks… WHAT!? Even though I made a point to NOT interact or stop for pictures… because it was giving the mascot extra exposure.
When we texted CFH (their preferred & efficient way to communicate) to see if they wanted us to address this with the client or if the office preferred to, it led to clarification regarding breaks, etc and the remainder of the day went well.
A few reviewers have referred to their interactions with CFH as rude. My experience was nothing less than pleasant, professional interaction… the immediate call regarding the issue mentioned WAS blunt & to the point… but this is a job and I was spoken to as a hired professional, in an attempt to make sure the client was receiving the service they contracted.
Payment was efficient (they stressed turning in the W-9 ASAP) and was received WITHIN the 14 days described. It was sent via email with a choice to collect electronically (for a small fee from vendor). I chose to just print the actual check & scan to my bank like any other paper check.
I work both in FL & NYC/CT Metro areas and would welcome the chance to work with CFH again… possibly not as a mascot, but definitely as a handler or an actor.

originalText.text: I was hired as a 70's disco dancer for MARTA's 40th anniversary celebration in Atlanta, GA.  It was my 1st time working with Characters For Hire and I'm glad to say that the communication the day of (and before) was clear & efficient, plus our coordinator was friendly and helpful. Getting to dance with other professionals was the "icing" on the cake of a festive event!

Getting to dance with other professionals was the "icing" on the cake of a festive event!

originalText.text: The professional experience that I received was spectacular! There wrestling show was the most fun me and my guests had!

text.text: The professional experience that I received was spectacular! There wrestling show was the most fun me and my guests had!

originalText.text: I had a great time working for CHARACTERS. I was dressed as The Grinch (my favorite character) for a major record label and I brought fun and entertainment to the employees of the label. They were asking for pictures and were full of laughter. CHARACTERS is a company that bring joy to the everyday person to higher elite people and I think that's great because it brings happiness and nostalgia to any and everybody. I look forward to working for CHARACTERS as a character again.

I look forward to working for CHARACTERS as a character again.

originalText.text:
We were extremely dissatisfied with Characters For Hire. We engaged their services for a corporate dinner event with a short turnaround--about two and half weeks.Given the condensed timescale, we were willing to pay a premium for expedited casting and rehearsals. Following consultations, we agreed with CfH on a three-person performance of "New York, New York". For a total cost nearing $4k, they assured that we would retain the services of three talented actors who would perform an improvised dance while singing the song. CfH would handle costuming and the players would meet beforehand to run the song in the space.

While we paid for a professional service, what we received was far from it. The actors had never met beforehand, did not know who their contact was, demanded payment for parking, and did not supply costumes. The “facilitator” provided by the company offended our venue/hosts and acquired the costumes unofficially. The performance itself was likewise underwhelming. There was no practice run or simple blocking determined by the actors, so they seemed uncoordinated.

While our guests were adequately entertained, the novelty value of an unexpected performance did not match the cost, nor the promises made in the weeks leading up to our use of Characters For Hire. Had we been promised less (given the short time span), asked for more direction, or charged less, this would have been an acceptable outcome. As it stands, the professionalism and quality we paid for was not delivered. Buyer beware.
